ğŸ’¥ I'm putting together a special one-time WORKSHOP addressing the elephant ğŸ˜ in the SM room
... I'm outlining 4 clear, very different paths to success with social media so we can each identify what we might be getting wrong & embark on the right path. I'll keep you posted! ğŸ¥³
Thing is, it's really no longer about pushing a massive firehose of content on your audience. (The 'crank out content' model died out several years ago. ğŸ˜³ğŸª¦).

It's allowing ourselves to be conditioned (manipulated) by big tech companies, believing the only way to succeed on their platforms is to crank out even more content and try all kinds of tricks + hacks to get our stuff seen, to get more reach, to grow our following, etc.ğŸ¤¯
It's being utterly fed up with (Facebook and/or Instagram) bugs, glitches, issues, lockouts, shut downs and more ... with zero support. ğŸ˜¢

It's #FacebookFatigue. ğŸ¥±

It's overall frustration with social media. ğŸ˜©

It's constantly jumping through hoops to comply with the latest algorithmic challenges for little reward. â­•ï¸

I see it myself in the feeds now - I'm on FB & IG a LOT (more than I care to admit, haha ğŸ¤ª) & invariably there's a lot less content. So, the algorithms keep showing me totally RANDOM posts - yes, I know that's the whole Recommendation/Discovery Engine at work, but still.

I've been talking about this sea change in pretty much all my presentations and keynotes this year. ğŸŒŠğŸ¤
I've been sensing, feeling, hearing and seeing this unfold gradually for some time.

There's a SEA CHANGE happening in the world of social media!
â¬…ï¸ AWAY from the constant push for more followers, reach, engagement, public-facing vanity metrics
â¡ï¸ TOWARDS metrics that matter, building genuine contacts, making sales & growing businesses
